exclusion:
1. Enable Exclusion for the Z-Wave binding
  2. Bring your Z-Wave gateway (hub) close to the switch, if possible
  3. Quickly tap the lower paddle on the dimmer 3 times
inclusion:
1. Enable Inclusion for the Z-Wave binding
  2. Quickly tap the upper paddle on the dimmer 3 times
  3. The LED indicators will blink to signal communication and remain on for 2 seconds to confirm inclusion
label: ZEN30
overview:
Features

  • Manual or Z-Wave control of 2 separate loads (dimmer + relay)
  • Perfect replacement for a fan / light combo (neutral wire required)
  • Scene control for multi-tap scenarios on select hubs
  • Quick and easy pigtail wire installation (single pole only)
  • 4-color LED indicator and air-gap switch for added safety
  • Packed with advanced dimming features including ramp rate control, custom on brightness level, and double tap to full brightness
  • Remembers and restores on/off status after power failure
  • Built-in Z-Wave Plus signal repeater to extend network range
  • S2 security protocol and 500 Z-Wave chip

Specifications

  • Model Number: ZEN30
  • Z-Wave Signal Frequency: 908.42 MHz
  • Power: 120 VAC, 60 Hz
  • Dimmer Max Load: 75 W LED, 250 W incandescent; DON’T use with tube lights, DC powered fixtures, or chandeliers
  • Relay Max Load: 15 A (1/2 HP)
  • Operating Temperature: 32-104° F (0-40° C)
  • Installation and Use: Indoor only

Scene Control

You can trigger up to 18 scenes or control up to 18 independent Z-Wave devices in your network using the Double Switch. You can assign scenes to 1-tap, 2-tap, 3-tap, 4-tap, 5-tap, or press-and-hold for any of the paddles and the relay button. Your hub needs to support central scene implementation for this feature to be available.

Full list of parameters for ZEN30 Double Switch VER. 3.10 firmware (or 1.20 for VER. 1.0 and 2.20 for VER. 2.0):

https://www.support.getzooz.com/kb/article/468-zen30-double-switch-advanced-settings/
usage:
Troubleshooting

  1. If the switch won’t add to your system, initiate EXCLUSION and tap the lower paddle 3 times quickly
  2. Tap the upper paddle 4-5 times quickly when adding it
  3. Bring the gateway controller (hub) closer to the switch, it may be out of range

Factory Reset

If your primary controller is missing or inoperable, you may need to reset the device to factory settings. To complete the reset process manually, press and hold the lower paddle on the dimmer for at least 15 seconds until the LED indicators start flashing, then release. Then immediately press and hold the upper paddle on the dimmer for at least 15 seconds. The LED indicators will flash again to confirm successful reset.

NOTE: All previously recorded activity and custom settings will be erased from the device’s memory.

category.label: Wall Switch
category.description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: LED Indicator Mode for Dimmer
parameters.overview:
Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when the switch (light) is on or off, or if you want it to remain on or off at all times. This setting is for the top status indicator only.

6 x TAP UPPER PADDLE to change the LED mode.

options.label: ON when switch is OFF and OFF when switch is ON
ON when switch is ON and OFF when switch is OFF

parameters.label: LED Indicator Control for Relay
parameters.overview:
Choose if you want the LED indicator to turn on when the relay is on or off, or if you want it to remain on or off at all times.

6 x TAP RELAY BUTTONto change the LED mode.

options.label: ON when relay is OFF and OFF when relay is ON
ON when relay is ON and OFF when relay is OFF

parameters.label: LED Indicator Color for Dimmer
parameters.description: Choose the color of the LED indicators for the dimmer

parameters.label: LED Indicator Color for Relay
parameters.overview: Choose the color of the LED indicator for the relay

parameters.label: LED Indicator Brightness for Dimmer
parameters.overview: Choose the LED indicators’ brightness level for the dimmer

parameters.label: LED Indicator Brightness for Relay
parameters.overview: Choose the LED indicators’ brightness level for the relay

parameters.label: LED Indicator Mode for Scene Control
parameters.description: LED Indicator Mode for Scene Control
parameters.overview: Choose if you want the LED indicators next to the dimmer to light up when a scene is selected. You’ll see 1 to 5 LEDs light up for 1 – 5 tap triggers and 6 LEDs light up for the press-and-hold trigger of any paddle / button used.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer for Dimmer
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the dimmer to automatically turn off once it has been turned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer for Dimmer
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the dimmer to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-Off Timer for Relay
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the relay to automatically turn off once it has been turned on. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: Auto Turn-On Timer for Relay
parameters.overview: Use this parameter to set the time after which you want the relay to automatically turn on once it has been turned off. The number entered as value corresponds to the number of minutes.

parameters.label: On Off Status After Power Failure
parameters.description: On Off Status After Power Failure
parameters.overview: Set the on/off status of the device after power failure.

options.label: Dimmer and relay forced to OFF
Dimmer forced to OFF, relay forced to ON
Dimmer forced to ON, relay forced to OFF
Restores status for dimmer and relay (default)
Restores status for dimmer, relay forced to ON
Restores status for dimmer, relay forced to OFF
Dimmer forced to ON, restores status for relay
Dimmer forced to OFF, restores status for relay
Dimmer and relay forced to ON

parameters.label: Ramp Rate Control for Dimmer
parameters.overview: Adjust the ramp rate for the dimmer (fade-in / fade-out effect for ON/OFF operation). Values correspond to the number of seconds it takes for the dimmer to reach full brightness or turn OFF when operated manually.

parameters.label: Minimum Brightness
parameters.overview: Set the minimum brightness level (in %) for the dimmer. You won’t be able to dim the light below the set value.

parameters.label: Maximum Brightness
parameters.overview: Set the maximum brightness level (in %) for the dimmer. You won’t be able to add brightness to the light beyond the set value.

parameters.label: Double Tap Function for Dimmer
parameters.overview: Choose if you want the dimmer to turn ON to full brightness or custom brightness level after you double-tap the upper paddle.

options.label: ON to full brightness with double tap (default)
ON to brightness set in #15 with double tap

parameters.label: Disable Double Tap
parameters.overview: Enable or disable the double-tap function and assign brightness level to single tap

options.label: Disabled, single tap for last brightness
Disabled, single tap to full brightness

parameters.label: Smart Bulb Setting
parameters.overview:
Enable or disable direct manual and Z-Wave control of the connected light. Works great for smart bulb control. If disabled, the dimmer will no longer control the connected bulb directly but will still send on/off and brightness reports to the hub so you can use them to create automations for your smart bulbs or other switches. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through paddles.

4 TAP’N’HOLD LOWER PADDLE to change the mode.

parameters.label: Remote Control Setting
parameters.overview:
Enable or disable direct manual and Z-Wave control of the connected load. Works great for smart bulbs or any type of remote / scene control. If disabled, the relay will no longer control the connected load directly but will still send on/off reports to the hub so you can use them to create automations for your smart bulbs or other devices. Scenes and other functionality will still be available through the button.

4 TAP’N’HOLD THE BUTTON to change the mode.

parameters.label: Manual Dimming Speed
parameters.overview: Choose how many seconds it takes for the dimmer to go from 0% to 100% brightness when pressing and holding the paddle. Increase the value to decrease the dimming speed.

parameters.label: Z-Wave Ramp Rate for Dimmer - REMOVED in v1.05
parameters.overview: Parameter REMOVED as of firmware version 1.05

parameters.label: Default Brightness Level ON for Dimmer
parameters.description: Set custom brightness level (in %) for the dimmer to come on to at single tap.
parameters.overview: Set custom brightness level (in %) for the dimmer to come on to at single tap

parameters.label: Dimmer Reporting Behavior when physical control is disabled.
parameters.description: Set reporting behavior for the dimmer when physical control is disabled.
parameters.overview:
0 – dimmer reports on/off status and brightness level and changes LED indicator state even if physical and Z-Wave control is disabled (default). 

1 – dimmer doesn't report on/off/brightness status changes and it doesn't change the LED indicator state when physical (and Z-Wave) control is disabled and paddles are pressed or the dimmer receives on/off commands from the hub.

parameters.label: Relay Reporting Behavior when physical control is disabled.
parameters.description: Set reporting behavior for the relay when physical control is disabled.
parameters.overview:
0 – relay reports on/off status and changes LED indicator state even if physical and Z-Wave control is disabled (default). 

1 – relay doesn't report on/off status changes and it doesn't change the LED indicator state when physical (and Z-Wave) control is disabled and the button is pressed or the relay receives on/off commands from the hub.

parameters.label: Night Light Mode
parameters.description: Set the brightness level (default 20%) the dimmer will turn on to when off and when lower paddle is held DOWN for a second.
parameters.overview: Set the brightness level (default 20%) the dimmer will turn on to when off and when lower paddle is held DOWN for a second.

parameters.label: Scene Control - Dimmer Paddles
parameters.description: Enable (default) or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers on the dimmer paddles.
parameters.overview: Enable (default) or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers on the dimmer paddles.

parameters.label: Scene Control - Relay Button
parameters.description: Enable (default) or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers on the relay button.
parameters.overview: Enable (default) or disable scene control functionality for quick double tap triggers on the relay button.

parameters.label: Programming on the Dimmer Paddles
parameters.description: Enable or disable programming functionality on the dimmer paddles. If this setting is disabled, then inclusion, exclusion, smart bulb mode no longer work when dimmer paddles are activated (factory reset and scene control will still work) - that means you
parameters.overview: Enable or disable programming functionality on the dimmer paddles. If this setting is disabled, then inclusion, exclusion, smart bulb mode no longer work when dimmer paddles are activated (factory reset and scene control will still work) - that means you can now use triple-tap triggers on the dimmer for scenes and remote control of other devices.

associations.label: BASIC_SET (dimmer)
associations.overview: The dimmer supports Group 2 with up to 5 devices and will send BASIC_SET report to other devices in Group 2 to communicate status changes.

associations.label: BASIC_SET (relay)
associations.overview: The relay supports Group 3 with up to 5 devices BASIC_SET report to other devices in Group 3 if its status changes.
